tools: Choose one type of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Gaming Set|XPHB}, or {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}

entries: {@i Choose A or B:} (A) {@item Club|XPHB}, {@item Handaxe|XPHB}, {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} or a {@item Gaming Set|XPHB} or {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB} (chosen for the tool proficiency above), {@item Dungeoneer's Pack|XPHB}, and 8 GP; or (B) 50 GP

classFeature.name: Iron Chin
entries: While you are wearing Light or no armor and not wielding a {@item Shield|XPHB}, your base {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equals 12 plus your Constitution modifier.

classFeature.name: Fisticuffs
entries: Your years of fighting in back alleys and taverns have given you mastery over combat styles that use {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} and Pugilist weapons, which are the following:
You gain the following benefits while you are unarmed or wielding only Pugilist weapons and you are wearing Light or no armor and are not wielding a {@item Shield|XPHB}.

entries.name: Bonus Unarmed Strike
entries: You can make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

entries.name: Fisticuffs Die
entries: You can roll {@dice 1d8} in place of the normal damage of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} or Pugilist weapons. This die changes as you gain Pugilist levels, as shown in the Fisticuffs column of the Pugilist Features table.

entries.name: Improved Improvisation
entries: Your talent for turning everything into a weapon allows you to use the mastery properties of {@variantrule Improvised Weapons|XPHB}. All Improvised Weapons count as having the {@itemMastery Sap|XPHB} mastery property for you.

classFeature.name: Moxie
entries: Your experience laying the beatdown on others has given you a moxie you can channel in the midst of battle. This swagger is represented by a number of Moxie Points. Your Pugilist level determines the maximum number of points you have, as shown in the Moxie Points column of the Pugilist Features table.
You can spend these points to enhance or fuel certain Pugilist features. You start knowing three such features: Brace Up, One-Two Punch, and Stick and Move, each of which is detailed below.
When you expend a Moxie Point, it is unavailable until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, at the end of which you regain all your expended points.
Some features that use Moxie Points require your target to make a saving throw. The save DC equals 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

entries.name: Brace Up
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} and expend 1 Moxie Point to brace for attacks. When you do so, roll your Fisticuffs die, and gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the number rolled plus your Pugilist level and your Constitution modifier. You lose any remaining {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} gained in this way after 10 minutes.

entries.name: One-Two Punch
entries: You can expend 1 Moxie Point to make two {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

entries.name: Stick and Move
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} and expend 1 Moxie Point to make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} and take the {@action Dash|XPHB} or {@action Disengage|XPHB} action.

classFeature.name: Big Dice Energy
entries: When you fail a Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, or Charisma check, you can expend a {@classFeature Moxie|Pugilist|Pugilist2024|2|Pugilist2024|Moxie Point} to attempt to swagger your way to success. Roll your Fisticuffs die and add the number rolled to the ability check, potentially turning it into a success. If the skill check still fails, you regain the expended Moxie Point and can't use this feature again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Bloodied but Unbowed
entries: When you take damage, you can regain all your expended {@classFeature Moxie|Pugilist|Pugilist2024|2|Pugilist2024|Moxie Points}. If you are {@status Bloodied|XPHB} when you use this feature, you also gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to four times your Pugilist level.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Heavy Hitter
entries: When you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} and don't use a mastery property as part of the attack, you can use both the {@variantrule Damage|XPHB} and your choice of the Grapple or Shove option.

classFeature.name: Pugilist Subclass
entries: You gain a Pugilist subclass of your choice. Squared Circle and Sweet Science subclasses are detailed after this class's description. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Pugilist levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Pugilist level or lower.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Dig Deep
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to dig deep for 10 minutes. During this time you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage and you ignore the effects of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels less than 6.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you take a level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} (no action required by you) to restore your use of it.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Haymaker
entries: When you make an attack with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} or Pugilist weapon, you can expend 1 {@classFeature Moxie|Pugilist|Pugilist2024|2|Pugilist2024|Moxie Point} to swing a wild haymaker. On a hit, regain the expended Moxie Point and you deal the maximum result of the attack's damage die rather than rolling.

classFeature.name: Moxie-Fueled Fists
entries: Whenever you deal damage with your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, it can deal your choice of Force damage or its normal damage type.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Pugilist Subclass.

classFeature.name: Down But Not Out
entries: When you use your Bloodied But Unbowed feature while you are {@status Bloodied|XPHB}, you can add a bonus to the damage of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} and attacks with Pugilist weapons for the next minute. This bonus equals your Constitution modifier plus the number of levels of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} you have.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Dig Deeper
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to dig deeper for 1 minute. During this time you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage, {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws, and you ignore the effects of any {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels you have.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: School of Hard Knocks
entries: You deal an additional {@damage 1d6} damage with your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} and attacks with Pugilist weapons. When you hit with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} or attack with a Pugilist weapon, you can forgo this additional damage to apply one of the following effects.

entries.name: Endanger
entries: The next time the creature is hit by an attack, instead of rolling for damage use the highest result of all damage dice.

entries.name: Provoke
entries: The creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls that don't include you as a target until the end of your next turn.

classFeature.name: Shake It Off
entries: With unflappable resolve, you can remove one of the following conditions from yourself at the start of each of your turns: {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, one level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, {@condition Restrained|XPHB}, or {@condition Stunned|XPHB}.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you take a level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} (no action required by you) to restore your use of it.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Pugilist Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Herculean
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Heavy Lifter
entries: Your Strength score counts as if it is doubled when determining your carrying capacity.

entries.name: Pillar Breaker
entries: Your damage against objects is doubled.

entries.name: Unmatched Athlete
entries: Your Strength score and modifier counts as if they are doubled when determining the number of feet you can leap with your {@variantrule High Jump|XPHB} and {@variantrule Long Jump|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Unbreakable
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws.
Additionally, whenever you make a saving throw and fail, you can expend 1 {@classFeature Moxie|Pugilist|Pugilist2024|2|Pugilist2024|Moxie Point} to reroll it, and you must use the new roll.

classFeature.name: Pugnacious
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can regain all expended {@classFeature Moxie|Pugilist|Pugilist2024|2|Pugilist2024|Moxie Points}. When you do so, you also regain the use of your {@classFeature Dig Deep|Pugilist|Pugilist2024|4|Pugilist2024}, {@classFeature Dig Deeper|Pugilist|Pugilist2024|9|Pugilist2024}, and {@classFeature Shake It Off|Pugilist|Pugilist2024|10|Pugilist2024} features as if you had finished a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Pugilist Subclass.

classFeature.name: Fighting Spirit
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead. When you do, you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half of your maximum {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, regain all your expended {@classFeature Moxie|Pugilist|Pugilist2024|2|Pugilist2024|Moxie Points}, and have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage for the next minute.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. {@feat Boon of Combat Prowess|XPHB} is recommended.

classFeature.name: Peak Physical Condition
entries: Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 2, to a maximum of 23.
In addition, when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} and you have the {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} condition, you lose all levels of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}.

subclass.name: Sweet Science
subclassFeatures: Float Like a Butterfly, Sting Like a Bee|Pugilist|Pugilist2024|Sweet Science|Pugilist2024|11

subclassFeature.name: Sweet Science
entries: Pugilists who practice the Sweet Science hit hard, fast, and often. This style is sometimes used by brawlers who battle for the entertainment of the upper classes, but is just as often practiced in back alleys and bars by those whose next meal depends on a knockout.

subclassFeature.name: Bare Knuckle Boxer
entries: Your attacks with {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} can score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

subclassFeature.name: Cross Counter
entries: You can block the brunt of an attack and launch one of your own in the same fluid motion. When you take damage from a melee attack, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and spend 1 {@classFeature Moxie|Pugilist|Pugilist2024|2|Pugilist2024|Moxie Point} to reduce the damage by {@dice 1d10} plus your Strength modifier and Pugilist level.
If you reduce the damage to 0, you can make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} or attack with a Pugilist weapon against a creature within reach as part of the same {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Combo Maker
entries: When you deal damage with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} against a creature, instead of also choosing the Grapple or Shove option with your {@classFeature Heavy Hitter|Pugilist|Pugilist2024|3|Pugilist2024} feature you can give yourself {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll you make against it before the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Float Like a Butterfly, Sting Like a Bee
entries: When you use your {@subclassFeature Cross Counter|Pugilist|Pugilist2024|Sweet Science|Pugilist2024|3} feature and hit a creature with your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, you regain 1 {@classFeature Moxie|Pugilist|Pugilist2024|2|Pugilist2024|Moxie Point}.

subclassFeature.name: Knock Out
entries: When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} against a creature, it has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. Once a creature gains the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition from this feature, it can't gain the condition from this feature again for 1 minute.

In addition, when you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and spend 1 {@classFeature Moxie|Pugilist|Pugilist2024|2|Pugilist2024|Moxie Point} to make the attack a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}. Once you use this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Squared Circle
entries: Pugilists who fight in the Square Circle know you don't have to knock an opponent senseless to get them to submit. Of course, these Pugilists do beat their opponents senseless, they just know they don't have to.

subclassFeature.name: Groundwork
entries: You gain the following abilities.

entries.name: Compression Lock
entries: When you start your turn with one or more creatures {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, you can roll your Fisticuffs die to deal damage to each creature you have {@condition Grappled|XPHB} equal to the die result plus your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Inescapable
entries: When a creature makes a saving throw or ability check against your Grapple or Shove DC, you can spend 1 {@classFeature Moxie|Pugilist|Pugilist2024|2|Pugilist2024|Moxie Point} to give that roll {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

entries.name: Stop and Drop
entries: When you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} and don't use a mastery property as part of the attack, you can use both the Grapple and Shove option.

subclassFeature.name: Muscle Mass
entries: Choose one of the following skills: {@skill Acrobatics|XPHB} or {@skill Athletics|XPHB}. If you lack proficiency with the chosen skill, you gain proficiency in it, and if you already have proficiency in it, you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in it.

subclassFeature.name: Meat Shield
entries: While you have a creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, you gain {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover} against all attacks made against you by a creature you are not {@variantrule Grappling|XPHB}. When an attack made by a creature you are not {@variantrule Grappling|XPHB} misses you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and spend 1 {@classFeature Moxie|Pugilist|Pugilist2024|2|Pugilist2024|Moxie Point} to have that creature make the same attack with a new roll against a creature you are {@variantrule Grappling|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Heavyweight
entries: You count as being one size larger for the purposes of {@variantrule Grappling|XPHB} and Shoving. In addition, you can move your full {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} when you are dragging or carrying a {@condition Grappled|XPHB} creature one size larger than you or smaller.

subclassFeature.name: Clean Finish
entries: When a creature starts its turn {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to force it to make a Constitution saving throw against your Grapple's escape DC or be {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} until the end of its next turn. If the creature is already {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} by this feature, its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} are reduced to 0 instead.
Once you use this feature to reduce a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Unarmed
entries: When you make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can deal the damage of this weapon instead of the damage normal for your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.
